website_summaries.verdict: When you're looking to run some knocking drills, this ball is perfect.
pros: Offers the feel of a high quality leather cricket ball
Designed for practice with its attached rope
Run all kinds of knocking and hand-eye coordination drills with this practice ball
Rope is firmly attached for a long lifespan
cons: Ball is not designed for game play, only for practice

customer_reviews.title: Worst quality ball I ever played with
customer_reviews.text: We practiced in nets with this ball and it did not last even for 10 overs. In less than 10 overs, it ripped apart ! One of the worst quality ball I ever played with and definitely not worth money. See attached pics.
customer_reviews.author: Ansh

customer_reviews.title: Not made of real Crickets
customer_reviews.text: I don't play cricket. I don't like cricket. I don't understand cricket. But the ball looks cool sitting on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Woodyard61

customer_reviews.title: The rope is ideal for not being annoying (black color) so that you can just focus on ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it heavily for knocking and batting practice and it does its job. The shine is maintained for quite a while, though the ball cracked a bit near the seam, but i guess it had to do with heavy use of batting practice. The rope is ideal for not being annoying (black color) so that you can just focus on the ball and at the same time, strong enough to withstand heavy strokes.
customer_reviews.author: Saddy

customer_reviews.title: Arrived cracked
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with cracks in both sides of the ball, running perpendicular to the seam.
customer_reviews.author: a customer

customer_reviews.title: not meeting the expectation
customer_reviews.text: i was expecting a trainer ball with a string and i just got a ball. There is no string and it is no use for the traing by self.
customer_reviews.author: krishna

customer_reviews.title: Great looking!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking ball and makes a nice souvenir. The only thing to note is that this is one ball and not the six shown in the picture. As I bought it for a gift, I cannot comment on its suitability for play.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Its 2 months of regular use and still in great shape with minimal damage
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Its 2 months of regular use and still in great shape with minimal damage . I have been using it to knock the new bat. I have steadily increased the speed with which i hit the ball. And so far it has come out with flying colors
customer_reviews.author: Sachin Patel

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad one to have!
customer_reviews.text: It's a good one to have for knocking BAT. Decent quality and with fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Surya

customer_reviews.title: Good quality balls meant for cricket
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for an upcoming cricket tournament. Used 4 of them already for practice and I am impressed by the quality. The weight is consistent. Not too heavy unlike some others that I had purchased. There is no obvious seam which is good in my opinion. The bounce is consistent as well. I will purchase this product again and am happy to recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: MeterManja

customer_reviews.title: Gives good indoor practice.
customer_reviews.text: stress busters for all the crickets in this tough time. 100 knocks a day would be good enough. Good quality ball n rope.
customer_reviews.author: Prem

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really good to have for practice... Hand and eye coordination gets better as you keep doing it...
customer_reviews.author: Rizwan Tarar

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: This is not useful product.. 1 - It doesn’t behave like cricket balls .. 2 - It doesn’t give the feel of playing cricket at all.. 3 - Even if you don’t middle the ball, it behaves as middled.. overall poor
customer_reviews.author: Ganesh k.

customer_reviews.title: When I received the product, it was somewhat deformed ...
customer_reviews.text: When I received the product, it was somewhat deformed, and I'm sure that it was used previously. There were small cracks on the surface of the ball. It did last me a week until it fully cracked. I'd give it a 4 star if the ball was new.
customer_reviews.author: Ayon

customer_reviews.title: Good quality knocking ball
customer_reviews.text: Good for knocking bats. Ball coating doesn’t stick to bat.
customer_reviews.author: Harish

customer_reviews.title: Awesome medium hard tennis ball for cricket
customer_reviews.text: Ideal weight and bounce for serious hard tennis ball cricket players. Weighs 128g approx which is less than the similar Nivia ball. The bowlers are able to generate good pace and bounce while bowling. As a batsman I get good stroke as well. Lasts 40+ overs easily without damage to the felt. Reducing my rating from 5 to 4 stars for the increase in price! :(
customer_reviews.author: Rookie007

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking Ball
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ball. More of an ornament for me though as I don't play cricket.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Wade

customer_reviews.title: These are a great alternative to actual leather cricket balls
customer_reviews.text: These are a great alternative to actual leather cricket balls. We use them for just playing in the park, and they've really served us well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cricket batting practice tool.
customer_reviews.text: Product works exactly as advertised. One minor flaw is the quality of the string. The threading started to unravel about first day, but it has held even through out hours of knocking so far. Just don't see it lasting more than a month maybe. The design of the ball is simple enough that the string can be replaced moderately easily though.
customer_reviews.author: Saad Ali Qureshi

customer_reviews.title: 5oz that would've been even better.
customer_reviews.text: These are decent balls for some bowling practice by myself. If they were a tiny bit heavier and close to 5.5oz that would've been even better.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the ball and the length of the thread.
customer_reviews.author: Nen Chill

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I am a cricket fan but could not play nowadays hence had a thought to practice ot in my home hence I bought this ball tied on my ceiling and playing crickey for 30 mins a day. Feeling relaxed and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Saihari

customer_reviews.title: This Pro-Impact is completely a horrible product and $17 for 6 balls is crazy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these balls based on the reviews but the quality of the ball is nowhere closer. We played just 12 overs and the first ball cracked open, then the second ball didn't even last for 5 overs. We usually play with Vicky Hard tennis balls and I have never seen that getting cracked. This Pro-Impact is completely a horrible product and $17 for 6 balls is crazy. Please stay away from this ball and better get a Vicky (from India) or even Cosco from somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: amazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: Good ball to practice with
customer_reviews.text: Good ball to practice with... wears out quickly though.... Would have have given 5stars if it was a better quality...
customer_reviews.author: Sagar

customer_reviews.title: The only problem why i would not recommend this ball is
customer_reviews.text: 1.The only problem why i would not recommend this ball is, it deflates when it hits the ground and because of this the balls delivers on the bat a little late making it difficult for the batsman. 2.It is very good for spin bowling. 3. It is good for indoor cricket doesn't break any valuable items.
customer_reviews.author: yash

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The ball quality is very good. However the string (threads) were coming off!
customer_reviews.author: smr3273

customer_reviews.title: Nice overal look too
customer_reviews.text: I use this as decor in my office. Solid weighting. Nice overal look too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris93

customer_reviews.title: It's a ball. It works like a ball should.
customer_reviews.text: It's a cricket ball and it works as a ball should.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M.

customer_reviews.title: Quite useless for cricket
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality - balls lack bounce and feel of hard ball

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I use it to knock by bat by suspending it in a sock. It has worked pretty well for me so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jain Tushar

customer_reviews.title: Great product for our needs
customer_reviews.text: These poly cricket balls were perfect for the pitch on which we play- a hard road base with some gravel. Balls eventually will break down but have good bounce and good for beginning players as soft enough to not injure anyone but solid and heavy enough to get a good feel of a cricket ball. I tried well over a dozen different type balls and this one worked the best. Order came fast and in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Billy A. Barr

customer_reviews.title: Average Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Started to crack after about a week of middling. absolutely no hard hitting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Little Smaller than the actual cricket ball but does the job
customer_reviews.author: dyoss

customer_reviews.title: Looks good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The ball looks fantastic and more expenses for the money that I paid
customer_reviews.author: OLGA CRUZ

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality of rope
customer_reviews.text: Ball is good but the quality of rope is bad got cut within few days.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil

customer_reviews.title: cricket lovely cricket
customer_reviews.text: these were gifts i gave young males some broke their windows with an errant hit no one cmplaind they were more interested with the quality cliff
customer_reviews.author: Clifford C. Perera

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: these are hit or a miss. some will crack soon and some will last longer
customer_reviews.author: mpat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ball for Tennis Cricket
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ball for Tennis Cricket.. "Ideal weight for Hard tennis cricket". Trusted the previous reviews and ordered it. Good Consistent bounce and lasted over 100 overs already. Wish if we could get this balls in slightly bigger size or something close to the leather ball. Stop buying the Nivya balls and try this one. I am sure you will be impressed.
customer_reviews.author: CHANCHAL SUR CHOWDHURY

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Me and my son play cricket in ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Me and my son play cricket in our yard. This is good for that. Little hard and bounce well in the driveway. Hard to find the ball if it get lost in the bush.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a very low quality cricket ball and not put together well.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. But could be cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: The product is great but could be a bit cheaper.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not the best our there as per husband. But ok to play with and the cheapest available!

customer_reviews.title: It's small
customer_reviews.text: Looks smaller than regular ICC approved cricket ball size. The leather is good and seam is well made. Just small.

customer_reviews.text: Got the Cricket Tennis ball which is hard and last long

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy tennis ball for playing cricket. But, don't play near parking lots. This ball can easily smash windshields.

customer_reviews.title: I like the ball
customer_reviews.text: Lasted long and came at a good price. The seller may be a bit finicky but this leather ball was one of the good ones I have had.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product. My young kids are using it for practice.
customer_reviews.author: Mm

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: These balls get soft extremely quickly. Not a good product we have bought probably a dozen and they all last only a very short time before losing new ball status.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Hawes

customer_reviews.title: not worth more than $1 per ball
customer_reviews.text: Cheap crap... this ball is an insult to be called a leather cricket ball. Leather started cracking immediately and there appears a small hole and all of this from a little bit indoor practice. Forget about using this ball for an actual game. Strongly recommend, spend a bit more and get a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Thankful

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for our team. So far they have kept-up the promise. For the price I paid, it is a good deal. But shipping cost is bit high.
customer_reviews.author: Pravin Asar

customer_reviews.title: Very good for single player.
customer_reviews.text: This is best knocking option, best part is you can practice any where by just hanging this and good to go. So single person can play.

customer_reviews.title: good ball for practice sessions
customer_reviews.text: Lost it form in a 15 over match, anyway, good ball for practice sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poly soft cricket balls
customer_reviews.text: The balls are good for playing since they give bounce and spin but do not require you to wear pads and other protective gear. Pro Impact sports sent me the wrong item but answered my query promptly and shipped out the proper balls on receipt of the wrong order. They also did not charge for shipping and handling. Good company.
customer_reviews.author: AMIT GUPTA

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Cricket balls did not last more than one over. I would not recommend them. The quality of these cricket balls have gone down significantly since last six months. I would not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Syed Rehan

customer_reviews.title: Ever worse cricket ball quality pathetic stuff
customer_reviews.text: I would like to urge other customers not to buy any kind of cricket balls from them because the quality they have shown in the pics is really good but when I open the box I saw the worse cricket balls ever. The balls are different in size colour shining from one side other side not even shined properly, they have mentioned that these cricket balls will last for 40 overs they, I will bet on that will not even last for 5 overs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The shape changed just after few overs and may only be good for practice and not for the game
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money I spent. The shape changed just after few overs and may only be good for practice and not for the game. One of the ball was damaged when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: MAJI

customer_reviews.title: little smaller and extra bouncy
customer_reviews.text: These are quality balls, but feels little smaller and extra bouncy.

customer_reviews.title: Not what was advertised
customer_reviews.text: The balls I ordered were supposed to be the same size and the same color, but they weren't, what's up with that!
customer_reviews.author: kimal brown

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The balls cracked very early, sometimes all it took was one stroke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It is a 4 piece leather ball. Ball seems good for the price it is sold for but looks smaller than the regular approved size. Overall, its a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rs_cricketer

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst cricket balls - leather cracks non-seam areas *DON'T BUY*
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst cricket balls. I played one practice session in nets and the ball is unusable. See the pix to believe. The ball has cracked on the non-seam sides which is unacceptable. Please stop selling such quality cricket ball.
customer_reviews.author: VA

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is good one. A bit hard for the beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Saumendra

customer_reviews.title: Pro Impact Made this right...
customer_reviews.text: The first ball we ordered was lost by the US Postal Service. When we contacted seller, they replaced the product and followed up with us to make sure we were satisfied. I'm very satisfied with their service, and the quality of the product and have bought other items (such as a bat) from Pro Impact with no issues, and will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product..... Don't buy....firstly there is red paint on the ball and it's not leather ball and after just 5mins paint is gone and after 15mins of practice the ball has a huge crack and the stitch is gone on one side..... My suggestion PLEASE DONT BUY.....
customer_reviews.author: Gurrrrram

customer_reviews.title: These look like they would be good for at least practice
customer_reviews.text: fast delivery. Was not used for the game, but to test artificial cricket pitch. These look like they would be good for at least practice.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice & heavy ball
customer_reviews.text: Nice & heavy ball. Genuine leather. My dog chewed it up in no time because he liked the leather. On to the next ball.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: All my friends are confused as to why I wanted to start a cricket team on my college campus, Now they can't get enough!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M. Carter

customer_reviews.title: 6 Pro impact Poly Soft PVC Cricket Balls
customer_reviews.text: This set of balls arrived much quicker than I had anticipated. The Order was well handled. Excellent Service.

customer_reviews.title: The finishing is not that great. The ball has some deformations - not that ...
customer_reviews.text: The finishing is not that great. The ball has some deformations - not that it is not round, but I saw minor bumps on the ball. Wished they would look into more of quality of finishing.
customer_reviews.author: Chasing Dreams

customer_reviews.title: Ball arrived as described. Ball was used as a ...
customer_reviews.text: Ball arrived as described. Ball was used as a prop for a research report so I can’t comment on durability.

customer_reviews.title: Meh!
customer_reviews.text: Not the quality you would expect when you pay ~$13

customer_reviews.title: Perfection for the money!
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is that it made a rather sad dent in my Defender. Besides that its just another high quality product from the lads at club-play
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: These cricket balls are solidly constructed, smell pleasantly of fresh leather and feel "just right" in the hand.
customer_reviews.text: These cricket balls are solidly constructed, smell pleasantly of fresh leather and feel "just right" in the hand.

product_meta.title: Pro Impact Cricket Balls
feature_bullets: IDEAL BALL FOR SELF-PRACTICE: The Pro Impact Leather Training Ball is a perfect choice for training yourself for those intense cricket matches. The ball is very easy to use and proves to be a good option to practice batting shots.

EQUIPPED WITH A DURABLE CORD: This leather cricket ball is attached to a black hanging cord which is very durable and does not damage easily. Even the length of the cord is long enough to ensure that you can hang the ball at a height of your choice.

HAND-STITCHED FOR EXTRA PRECISION: This leather ball is hand-stitched using genuine tanned leather. The leather is very durable and can easily take the impact of a number of intense cricket matches. Hand-stitching is done using 5 ply thread which removes any possibility of error in the stitching.

MADE USING NATURAL CORK FOR DURABILITY: The Pro Impact Leather Cricket Ball has natural cork at its center which offers it strength and durability. The presence of natural cork ensures that the ball remains in its original state even after consistent hitting.

IDEAL FOR HAND-EYE COORDINATION: The Pro Impact Leather Training Ball is a good way to enhance your hand-eye coordination by hitting consistent shots with it. The ball also helps you to improve your batting skills and increases the accuracy of your shots.
